meanings.definition: An underground room or vault beneath a church, used as a burial place.
meanings.sent1: The ancient church had crypts where the deceased were laid to rest.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the cathedral were in awe of the crypts below, filled with history.
meanings.sent3: The crypts were so quiet that even the mice tiptoed around, afraid to disturb the peace.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like crypts, each holding secrets and stories waiting to be uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The crypts echoed with whispers of the past, haunting yet comforting.

meanings.sent1: The crypts in the body play a role in digestion and absorption of nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the crypts closely to understand their function in the body.
meanings.sent3: The crypts in the stomach were like tiny factories producing enzymes for digestion.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revealed the crypts of happiness hidden within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The crypts in the body were like tiny treasure troves of health and well-being.
